subject: Management
title: Remote Team Communication
description: A 60-second lesson on Remote Team Communication.

hook.text: A remote team used only Slack. They were efficient but felt disconnected. Collaboration suffered.

buildup.text: Remote teams lose casual hallway interactions where informal knowledge sharing happens.

discovery.text: Research shows remote teams need deliberate social rituals to replace what co-location provides free.

twist.text: More messages doesn't mean better communication. Richness of medium matters too.

climax.text: Mix async text for updates, video for complex discussions, and casual chats for bonding.

punchline.text: Remote work is free. Remote relationships cost deliberate effort.

quiz.question: What do remote teams need that co-located teams get naturally?
options: Deliberate social rituals to build connection and share knowledge
More text-based messages to compensate for lack of presence
Fewer meetings since everyone can work independently
